dt: {bc}to arrange (troops, equipment, etc.) in a straight line and at proper intervals
{bc}to prepare for cooking or for the table
{bc}to add decorative details or accessories to {bc}{sx|embellish||}
{bc}to arrange (the hair) by combing, brushing, or curling
{bc}to kill and prepare for market or for consumption
{bc}to trim and smooth the surface of (a material, such as lumber or stone)
{bc}to put on or wear formal, elaborate, or fancy clothes
{bc}to align oneself with the next soldier in a line to make the line straight
{bc}to ornament a ship for a celebration by hoisting national ensigns at the mastheads and running a line of signal flags and pennants from bow to stern

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}drescer, dresser{/it} to direct, put right, from Vulgar Latin {it}*directiare{/it}, from Latin {it}directus{/it} direct, past participle of {it}dirigere{/it} to direct, from {it}dis-{/it} + {it}regere{/it} to lead straight {ma}{mat|right|}{/ma}
shortdef: to arrange (troops, equipment, etc.) in a straight line and at proper intervals
to prepare for use or service; specifically : to prepare for cooking or for the table

dt: {bc}an outer garment (as for a woman or girl) usually consisting of a one-piece bodice and skirt
{bc}covering, adornment, or appearance appropriate or peculiar to a particular time

shortdef: an outer garment (as for a woman or girl) usually consisting of a one-piece bodice and skirt
covering, adornment, or appearance appropriate or peculiar to a particular time

dt: {bc}relating to or used for a dress

shortdef: relating to or used for a dress

shortdef: the first or lowest curved tier of seats above the main floor in a theater or opera house

shortdef: to dress casually especially for reasons of fashion

shortdef: a day during which employees are allowed to wear casual attire at work

dt: {bc}a full rehearsal (as of a play) in costume and with stage properties shortly before the first performance
{bc}a practice exercise for something to come {bc}{sx|dry run||}

a practice exercise for something to come : dry run

dt: {bc}a pad worn inside a part of the clothing liable to be soiled by perspiration (as at the underarm)

shortdef: a pad worn inside a part of the clothing liable to be soiled by perspiration (as at the underarm)

dt: {bc}a man's shirt especially for wear with evening dress
{bc}a shirt suitable for wear with a necktie

shortdef: a man's shirt especially for wear with evening dress; broadly : a shirt suitable for wear with a necktie
